item.title: UW News • Women's Basketball: Badgers claim 74-73 comeback win over Penn State, remain undefeated at home
item.description: A back-and-forth game ended with an electric fourth-quarter comeback for the Badgers as the Wisconsin women's basketball team (11-4, 3-1 B1G) defeated the Penn State Nittany Lions (7-8, 0-4 B1G), 74-73, on Sunday afternoon at the Kohl Center to extend its home win streak to nine games.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Booth signs with Italian Serie A1 League
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - After an illustrious collegiate career, middle blocker Carter Booth has signed with the Unione Yamamay Busto Arisizio of the Italian Serie A1 League to begin her professional tenure.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Wisconsin lands at No. 8 in Fall Learfield Directors' Cup
item.description: The National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics and LEARFIELD released its Fall Division I Learfield Directors' Cup standings this Tuesday, with Wisconsin placing eighth after a another successful fall season.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Badgers use second-half surge to oust Central Michigan
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team used a 23-3 second-half run to fly past Central Michigan on Monday night at the Kohl Center, 88-61.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Volleyball adds Travis and Hoppe
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - Head coach Kelly Sheffield of the Wisconsin volleyball program has announced the signing of outside hitter Eva Travis from UC Santa Barbara and setter Isabelle Hoppe from Pine-Richland High School in Gibsonia, Pa. Both Travis and Hoppe will arrive for spring semester of 2026.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Volleyball signs standout Auguste
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - Head coach Kelly Sheffield of the Wisconsin volleyball team has announced the signing of AVCA All-American Jaela Auguste after spending a pair of seasons at Florida. Auguste will arrive at UW for the start of the 2026 spring semester.

item.title: Brewers News: Now fully healthy, Henderson ready to build on brilliant start to career
UW News • Women's Basketball: Badgers tame Jaguars in final non-conference battle
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The Wisconsin women's basketball team outlasted IU Indy in their final home game of 2025, securing an 81-72 victory to wrap up their non-conference slate.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Five Things to Know: UW vs. Central Michigan
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team returns to the Kohl Center to take on Central Michigan on Monday.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Badger comeback falls short against Villanova
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team fell to Villanova 76-66 on Friday night at the Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Colyer named AVCA Outside Hitter of the Year
item.description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. - Senior standout Mimi Colyer was named the American Volleyball Coaches Association Outside Hitter of the Year on Friday morning, fresh off of leading the Wisconsin volleyball team to their seventh appearance in the NCAA Championships and a 28-5 overall record.

item.title: UW News • Women's Basketball: Starting Five: Badgers host IU Indy for final home game of 2025
item.description: Wisconsin concludes non-conference play

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Badgers season ends in five-set thriller
item.description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. - The No. 3 Wisconsin volleyball team saw their season come to a conclusion in the NCAA National Semifinals versus No. 1 Kentucky (25-12, 22-25, 25-21, 24-26, 13-15) in a five-set thriller.

UW News • Volleyball: Colyer, Booth earn AVCA All-American honors
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - After a pair of stellar individual seasons, seniors Mimi Colyer and Carter Booth of the Wisconsin volleyball team each garnered All-America honors from the American Volleyball Coaches Association, as announced on Wednesday morning by the AVCA.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Five Things to Know: UW vs. Villanova in Milwaukee Hoops Showdown
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team returns to action with the Milwaukee Hoops Showdown on Friday.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: The Dream Continues: No. 3 Badgers travel to Kansas City for National Semifinals
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 3 Wisconsin volleyball team will continue its journey in the NCAA Tournament on Thursday, Dec. 18, as they will take on No. 1 Kentucky in the National Semifinals at the T-Mobile Center in Kansas City. First serve will occur 30 minutes following the conclusion of the first semifinal between No. 3 Texas A&M and No. 1 Pittsburgh, which is slated to start at 5:30 p.m. CT. Both matches will be televised on ESPN.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Colyer Named Finalist for AVCA Player of the Year
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – Mimi Colyer of the Wisconsin volleyball team has been named one-of-four finalists for the 2025 AVCA Division I Player of the Year Award, announced by the AVCA Monday evening.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Hooked on a feeling: Badgers punch ticket to Kansas City
item.description: AUSTIN, Texas - The No. 3 Wisconsin volleyball team punched their ticket to the NCAA National Semifinals for the sixth time in program history, storming into Gregory Gymnasium to take down No. 1 Texas (25-22, 25-21, 20-25, 25-19) in four sets.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Badgers to host pair of Greg Gard Shows live at Buck and Honey’s
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – Fans are welcome to join the Badgers at Buck and Honey's as UW will host a pair of Greg Gard Shows at their establishments.

item.title: UW News • Football: 91 Badgers named to 2025-26 Fall Academic All-Big Ten team
item.description: The Big Ten Conference announced its 2025-26 Fall Academic All-Big Ten teams this Wednesday, with a tremendous 91 student-athletes at the University of Wisconsin-Madison achieving the honor.

item.title: UW News • Women's Basketball: Badgers outpace San Diego, 74-46
item.description: Thanks to 42 points off the bench, the Wisconsin women's basketball team beat San Diego 75-46 on Wednesday at the Kohl Center.

item.title: UW News • Football: Wisconsin falls at Minnesota in season finale
item.description: The Wisconsin Badgers (4-8) fell to the Minnesota Golden Gophers (7-5) by a 17-7 score Saturday evening to wrap up the 2025 season.
